description:
When it comes time for building snow forts and skating on the pond, the Frost Piercer Jacket has the warmth to keep youngsters comfy on Canada's coldest days. As the name implies, it's packed with thick insulation to cut the East Coast chill, and MEC's own VarioShell membrane to block the wind or rain in the West. All that, plus a streamlined insulated hood, make this the warmest kids jacket in the MEC-label line.

  • 2-layer recycled nylon shell with MEC's VarioShell waterproof-breathable membrane
  • Shell has a durable water repellency finish (DWR) that sheds snow and repels light rain
  • Soft recycled nylon lining glides over layers
  • 280g ThermoLite T3 EcoMade high loft insulation (87% recycled) in the body and hood and 200g in the arms for toasty warmth
  • Soft brushed fleece around hood edge and on chin placket for comfort against skin
  • Quilted construction keeps insulation in place
  • 2 storm flaps, one behind zipper and one in front, prevent wind from sneaking through
  • Elasticized cuffs keep out cold and snow
  • 2 zippered handwarmer pockets with cozy fleece lining
  • Hand-me-down ID label
name: MEC Frost Piercer Jacket - Youths
